result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Safwan E Takar

records.addlTxt: ADA Timothy Robert Verhoff appeared for the State. Attorney Mark Phillip Maciolek appeared in person on behalf of Defn. State will be filing Motion to Join. File review scheduled.
Status conference on December 2, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
and notice of DNA and witness list - State's

Information was e-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defn waived reading of Information; Counsel enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of Defendant; motions due within 20 days; bail continued

*** IN CUSTODY ***

1:58 PM Defendant Safwan E Takar in court.  Attorney Mark Phillip Maciolek in court for Safwan E Takar.  ADA Daniel R. Hess in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Law Enforcement, Detective C. Kraigkalka duly sworn & testified; Direct exam by ADA Hess, Venue Established; Witness ID'd defn; Cross exam by Attorney Maciolek. Detective S. Korger duly sworn & testified. Direct exam by ADA Hess. Cross exam by Attorney Maciolek. State moves for bindover - waives argument, reserves for rebuttal; Defense objects to bindover - gives argument; Rebuttal by ADA Hess. Ct binds case over; bail continued
Media request for cameras in courtroom - WISCTV (approved)

Adjustment Number: 22A 048815,
Payable Number: 578412,
Receipt Number: 22RS044448,
Amount: $20.00

Cash bond is set in the amount of $15,000 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _x_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor. 
_x_ Regardless of when cash bail (if required) is posted, or when a signature bond is signed, the jail shall only release the defendant if the defendant can  be outfitted directly by Pretrial Services with any required equipment prior to the defendant being released from the jail. (PRIOR APPROVAL BY PRETRIAL SERVICES REQUIRED) 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with OCW. 
- Defendant shall not be on any University of Wisconsin-Madison property as defined by the attached map. 
- Defendant shall not be in the 100 block of N Park St. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial Judge - Br 2
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS)

1:53 PM Defendant Safwan E Takar in court, in custody.  Attorney Mark Phillip Maciolek in court for Safwan E Takar.  Prosecuting attorney Tomas Fernando Valerio in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
